text: attempt on O is pretty much one of the
most festive centerpiece main dishes you
can make for a party I've updated this
version it's faster it's fresher and
just as delicious you want to start out
with something big enough to bake the
entire tempeh no in I'm using a Dutch
oven because it's nice and sturdy and
you want to butter it so the tempeh know
doesn't stick in a very traditional
tempeh no you would make your own pasta
dough by hand and then you'd roll it out
and you'd have this big sheet of thin
hand rolled pasta dough in this version
I'm telling you that it's okay to buy
premade fresh lasagna noodles they work
just as well
the hardest part actually may be
sourcing the fresh lasagna noodles you
will probably have to go to an Italian
specialty shop see how there are these
empty spots over here where the dough
isn't covering the pot you want to just
take another piece of dough I just cut
it into a UH a section and then I'm just
going to press it right in it's okay if
the dough overlaps so this is just some
fresh ricotta that I'm going to season
with basil touch of nutmeg black pepper
and egg basically the egg is just to
give the ricotta a little bit of body so
that when you mix it into the pasta it
doesn't disappear but it stays its own
distinct layer and then it's prettier
when you cut it a good strategy for
making your Tim paano is to do as much
as you can ahead you can make the sauce
ahead and the sausage ahead and then
that day all you have to do is layer all
the ingredients together and bake it off
and this is fresh a buffalo mozzarella
I'm just going to tear it into chunks
and throw it right in so you want to use
1/3 of the pasta for this layer and if
you're a type-a kind of person which I'm
usually not but in this case I'm going
to do it you should line up all the
penne in little rows because then when
you cut the Tim Pato it's so much more
beautiful so just get in there with your
fingers
what makes this tempeh know a little
more contemporary is that for one I
added some broccoli rabe and some
roasted butternut squash makes it a
little bit lighter and it's actually
really beautiful when you cut into it so
this is the final layer of the penne and
then you just want to fold the pasta
sheets right over this turns out to be
the bottom once you flip it over so what
happens down here stays between you and
the tempeh know no one's going to see it
you can really tailor a temp on O to
your own tastes for example if you're
not into broccoli rabe you could use

add a little more cheese after this has
